musicCollection.title: Nordic Roots Music
musicCollection.shortdesc: I have seen all of these artists (and much, much more) live at one Nordic Roots festival or another. What a nice place is the Cedar Cultural Center!

cdRow.comments: The Norwegian fiddles are taking over.
Rockin with the fiddles and the gurdies and the wondrous Swedish vocals.
Kind of a Lord of the Rings vibe. Eerie vocals, fiddle, drums, and a variable Strange Instrument.
Their album says "Bad fiddles from Sweden". I disagree.
The almighty polska will have you out of your chair and in the air.
Energy that is just as palpable, fun just as contagious, and humor just as silly as it was for everyone at the venue that evening.
A must for all of those rabid Hurdy Gurdy fans.
Their version of Ievan's Polka is an inspiration to everybody with a leek.
So good she made it onto the Best of the Cedar album.
They may think otherwise, but I think all of the album names are great.

ol.li: 10 Years of Triakel (only available at live shows)

cdRow.comments: The boat song is a wonder to behold. Or is it to be-listen? Much calmer than her Garmarna work and his Hoven Droven work.
That Lord of the Rings vibe is even stronger here – considering they do the music for the stage version. Check out the Live album.

ol.li: Live at the Nordic Roots Festival

cdRow.comments: Considered by many to be the best band in the world.

link.desc: The Cedar is a highly eclectic music venue located in the vibrant West Bank district of Minneapolis. Renowned for hosting some of the best acts in folk, blues, jazz, indie rock and world music in an intimate space, the Cedar is a 501(c)3 non-profit, largely volunteer-driven organization.
The album that could change your life...
